author: Staff Reporter
text:
Under the Dam Rehabilitation and Improvement Project (DRIP), various works are being carried out at Rs. 10.72 crore in Stanley Reservoir in Mettur Dam and works are expected to be completed before next monsoon season, said S. Ashokan, Chief Engineer, Tiruchy Region, Water Resources Organisation, here on Thursday.

Addressing reporters after carrying out inspection at Stanley Reservoir, he said that work is on to install modern seismograph instruments, power generators, modern lighting conductors and also digital automatic water level recorder in the dam. “All the work would be over before next monsoon,” he added. Asked whether water would be released for irrigation on the customary date on June 12, Mr. Ashokan said that based on the inflow and storage level in May, water release would be decided. He also added that the present storage of 23.64 tmc is adequate for drinking water requirements till August.

Currently, a team from Indian Institute of Technology, Chennai, led by Professor of Structural Engineering Division, P. Alagusundaramoorthy, is carrying out a stability study on the 16-vent Ellis Saddle Bridge at a cost of Rs. 31 lakh. Based on the report, if instability is pointed out, works would be undertaken to strengthen the bridge, he added.

Officials said that 140 tmc of water was released for Delta irrigation from August, 2015 to February, 2016.

title: Stanley Reservoir work to be over before monsoon
